characters.definition: Father of Aequa. Governance senator.

characters.title: Quintus
characters.definition: Father of Belli, and the proconsul in Sytrece.
Daughter of Advenius. Attended the Academy with Vis.

characters.title: Magnus Tertius
characters.definition: Father of Iro
Septimus in charge of the stables at the Academy.

characters.title: Matron
characters.definition: Woman in charge of the orphanage at Letens.
Attended the Academy with Vis.
Attended the Academy with Vis.
Brother to Ulciscor. Killed during the Iudicium at the Academy several years ago.
Vis's friend from the Academy.
Vis's younger sister, princess of Suus.

characters.title: King
characters.definition: Vis's father, king of Suus.
Vis's birth name, and also the name he gives to the alupi he saved as a pup on Solivagus.

characters.title: Praeceptor
characters.definition: Teacher in charge of Class Six at the Academy.
Vis's friend from the Academy.
Woman in charge of the fights at the Letens Theatre.
Attended the Academy with Vis. Romantically involved with him during their time there.

characters.title: Magnus Tertius
characters.definition: Censor of the Republic, and father of Callidus and Livia.
Also known as Melior, leader of the Anguis. Former advisor to King Cristoval, and former tutor to Vis.

characters.title: Princeps
characters.definition: Princeps of Military.
Former advisor to King Cristoval, and former tutor of Vis's. Current steward of Suus under the Hierarchy.
Attended the Academy with Vis.
The Septimus in charge of Letens Prison, under whom Vis was once employed.
Attended the Academy with Vis.
Attended the Academy with Vis. Son of Dimidius Quiscil of Military.
Attended the Academy with Vis. Younger sister killed during the attack on the naumachia.
Dispensator in charge of running Villa Telimus. Former head of the Azriat in Sytrece.
Tutor to Vis during his time at Villa Telimus. Assisting Ulciscor in his search to find the truth about Caeror's death.

characters.title: Magnus Quartus
characters.definition: the Senate-ratified leader of Military's forces in Caten.
Sister of Callidus and daughter of Magnus Tertius Ericius.

characters.title: Proconsul
characters.definition: Catenan in charge of the Tensian province.
Attended the Academy with Vis.
Assistant to Veridius at the Academy.

characters.title: Praeceptor
characters.definition: Teacher in charge of Class Three at the Academy.
mysterious ally of the Anguis, who can travel between Res and Luceum.
Attended the Academy with Vis.

characters.title: Magnus Dimidius
characters.definition: Indol's father.
elderly man who tests Vis' blood, and conducts an unusual interview of him prior to his Governance Placement test.

characters.title: Magnus Quartus
characters.definition: One of the Magnus Quartii vying for the position of Military's Princeps.
Ulciscor's wife. Anguis spy.

characters.title: Praeceptor
characters.definition: Teacher in charge of Class Four at the Academy.
Attended the Academy with Vis.

characters.title: Praeceptor
characters.definition: Teacher in charge of Class Five at the Academy.
Vis's adoptive father. Magnus Quintus in Military.
Physician at the Academy.
The Principalis, in charge of the Academy.
The name chosen by Diago after he fled Suus. Added to after his adoption by Ulciscor Telimus, and then again by the Senate after his heroics at the naumachia.
Vis's older sister, princess of Suus.

glossary.definition: Massive, intelligent wolf-like creatures indigenous to Solivagus.
Stone monoliths used as infrastructure for Transvects.
The group continuing to rebel against the Hierarchy.
God of childbirth, prophecy, and luck.
The pre-Cataclysm devices which enable people to cede Will.
Library.
A military ship with two decks of oars.
The set of Catenan laws designed to "honour life."
The act, in the Hierarchy, of giving half your Will to someone ranked directly above you.
The Governance senator in charge of determining who can be nominated for the Senate.
The main hall of the Academy.
The "Right to Death," a Cymrian legal and philosophical code that honours death as a sacrifice.
God of keys, doors, livestock, and ports.
A popular strategic game in the Hierarchy, played with red and white triangular stones.
The name used to refer to the device which copied Vis into Obiteum and Luceum.
The final test at the Academy for Class Three students, used to determine their rankings.
God of sky and thunder, the king of the gods.
God of war and fighters, agricultural guardian.
Gladiatorial battle taking place on ships, on an artificial lake. Participants are called Naumchiarii.
Goddess of rivers.
Goddess of autumn and the harvest.
Teacher status in the Academy.
Building housing the teachers' offices at the Academy.
The large, central courtyard of the Academy.
The name for an obsidian blade forged by a Catenan officer.
Goddess of spring, flowers, and fertility.
Binding legal agreement in the Hierarchy to not speak of something.
Massive Will-powered transport devices.
Devices that can force-feed Will into any body or substance capable of decay.
God of volcanoes, deserts, the forge, and hard work.

locations.definition: The region near Caten where the Necropolis is located.
A district of Caten.
Small country bordering Suus. The country in which Vis officially claims he was born.
The capital of Deditia and of the Catenan Republic, considered to be the centre of the known world.
The Academy which Vis attends, located on the island of Solivagus.
The great stadium in Caten which can house up to one hundred thousand people.
The name used to describe any region governed by Caten's laws.
Country to the south-west of Caten.
The region immediately surrounding Caten.
A district of Caten.
Country whose treaty restricts Catenan ambassadors there from using Will.
Capital of Tensia.
The prison in which Vis once worked.
A famous landmark in Caten.
A mysterious place, usually referenced alongside Res and Obiteum.
A Catenan territory.
A Catenan territory.
A large area dedicated to the Catenan dead, located in the Agerus region.
Desert-locked country far to the north-east.
A mysterious place, usually referenced alongside Res and Luceum.
District of Caten.
The sea on which both Solivagus and Caten are located.
A mysterious place, usually referenced alongside Obiteum and Luceum.
District of Caten.
Island on which the Academy is located.
Vis's island homeland.
Country to the east of Deditia.
Southernmost populated country in the known world.
